title: Husker Du - The Living End (1994) (olde_punks)
description:
From Wiki (abridged):
The Living End is a HÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¼sker DÃƒÆ’Ã†â€™Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¼ live album recorded at various venues in October 1987 but not released until 1994.

Guitarist Bob Mould and drummer Grant Hart handled the overwhelming share of songwriting duties in the band. Of interest is "Everytime," a rare solo credit for bassist Greg Norton.

Over half of the songs were recorded at Le Spectrum in Montreal. The album was deleted from the Warner Bros catalogue in 2003.

In an interview with Spin magazine in January 2008, Bob Mould revealed that he has never heard this album.

   1. "New Day Rising" (Mould/Hart/Norton) (Washington 10/21/87)
   2. "Girl Who Lives on Heaven Hill" (Hart) (Montreal 10/14/87)
   3. "Standing in the Rain" (Mould) (Toronto 10/13/87)
   4. "Back from Somewhere" (Hart) (Washington 10/20/87)
   5. "Ice Cold Ice" (Mould) (Montreal 10/14/87)
   6. "Everytime" (Norton) (Montreal 10/14/87)
   7. "Friend, You've Got to Fall" (Mould) (Montreal 10/14/87)
   8. "She Floated Away" (Hart) (Montreal 10/14/87)
   9. "From the Gut" (Mould/Norton) (Providence 10/16/87)
  10. "Target" (Mould) (Washington 10/20/87)
  11. "It's Not Funny Anymore" (Hart) (Montreal 10/14/87)
  12. "Hardly Getting Over It" (Mould) (Toronto 10/13/87)
  13. "Terms of Psychic Warfare" (Hart) (Montreal 10/14/87)

  24. "Sheena Is a Punk Rocker" (Ramones) (Montreal 10/14/87)
